00015  * interface 
00016  * @package kata_model

00018 interface dbo_interface {
00019 
00020     /**
00021      * REPLACE works like INSERT,
00022      * except that if an old row in the table has the same value as a new row for a PRIMARY KEY or a UNIQUE  index,
00023      * the old row is deleted before the new row is inserted
00024      *
00025      * @param string $tableName replace from this table
00026      * @param array $fields name=>value pairs of new values
00027      * @param string $pairs enquoted names to escaped pairs z.B.[name]='value'
00028      * @return int modified rows.
00029      */
00030     function replace($tableName, $fields, $pairs);
00031 
00032     /**
00033      * a copy of the matching db-config entry in config/database.php
00034      * @param $string $what spezifies what to get ... null=complete config array
00035      * @return array|string
00036      */
00037     function getConfig($what= null);
00038 
00039     /**
00040      * set db-config entry
00041      * @param $array $config
00042      */
00043     function setConfig($config);
00044 
00045     /**
00046          * checks if given operator is valid
00047          * @param string $operator
00048          * @return boolean
00049          */
00050     function isValidOperator($operator);
00051 
00052     /**
00053      * connect to the database
00054      */
00055     function connect();
00056 
00057     /**
00058      * are we connected?
00059      */
00060     function isConnected();
00061 
00062     /**
00063      * return the current link to the database, connect first if needed
00064      */
00065     function getLink();
00066 
00067     /**
00068      * inject dblink into dbo
00069      */
00070     function setLink($l);
00071 
00072     /**
00073      * unused right now, later possibly used by model to set right encoding
00074      */
00075     function setEncoding($enc);
00076 
00077     /**
00078      * execute query and return useful data depending on query-type
00079      *
00080      * @param string $s sql-statement
00081      * @param array $idname which field-value to use as the key of the returned array (false=dont care)
00082      * @return array
00083      *
00084      */
00085     function & query($s, $idnames= false);
00086 
00087     /**
00088      * escape the given string so it can be safely appended to any sql
00089      * @param string $sql string to escape
00090      * @return string
00091      */
00092     function escape($sql);
00093 
00094     /**
00095     * used to quote table and field names
00096     * @param string $s string to enquote;
00097     * @return string enquoted string
00098     */
00099     function quoteName($s);
00100 
00101     /**
00102      * output any queries made, how long it took, the result and any errors if DEBUG
00103      * close the connection
00104      */
00105     function __destruct();
00106 
00107     /**
00108      * build a sql-string that returns first matching row
00109      * @param string $sql SQL-String
00110      * @param string $perpage expresion
00111      * @return string finished query
00112      */
00113     function getFirstRowQuery($sql, $perpage);
00114 
00115     /**
00116      * build a sql-string that returns paged data
00117      * @return string finished query
00118      */
00119     function getPageQuery($sql, $page, $perPage);
00120 
00121     /**
00122      * return the sql needed to convert a unix timestamp to datetime
00123      * @param integer $t unixtime
00124      * @return string
00125      */
00126     function makeDateTime($t);
00127 
00128     /**
00129      * try to reduce the fields of given table to the basic types bool, unixdate, int, string, float, date, enum
00130      *
00131      * <code>example:
00132      *
00133      * Array
00134      * (
00135      *     [table] => test
00136      *     [primary] => array
00137      *     [unique] => array
00138      *     [cols] => Array
00139      *         (
00140      *             [a] => Array
00141      *                 (
00142      *                     [default] => CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
00143      *                     [null] =>
00144      *                     [length] => 0
00145      *                     [type] => date
00146      *                 )
00147      *
00148      *             [g] => Array
00149      *                 (
00150      *                     [default] =>
00151      *                     [null] =>
00152      *                     [length] => 0
00153      *                     [type] => unsupported:time
00154      *                 )
00155      *         )
00156      *
00157      * )
00158      * </code>
00159      *
00160      * @param string $tableName name of the table to analyze
00161      * @return unknown
00162      */
00163     function & describe($tableName);
00164 }
